intro: Gutierrezia diversifolia, commonly known as sand蒿 or desert bush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small yellow flowers. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, linear leaves adapted to arid environments. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. Gutierrezia diversifolia plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing forage for wildlife in its native range.
